me.taylorkelly.mywarp.util

Class PropertiesUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.taylorkelly.mywarp.util.PropertiesUtils

  • public final class PropertiesUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides utility methods for working with Properties.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void copyMissing(java.io.File file, java.util.Properties defaults)
      Copies key-value-pairs found in the given Properties but not in the given File into it.

      Copies key-value-pairs found in the given Properties but not in the given File into it.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • copyMissing

        public static void copyMissing(java.io.File file,
                               java.util.Properties defaults)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Copies key-value-pairs found in the given Properties but not in the given File into it. The file is expected to exist and contain a structure readable as Properties.

        Instead of using the sytem's default encoding, this method will use UTF-8 to write the file. A comment about the encoding is added to the file if changes need to be saved.

        Parameters:
        file - the file that potentially has missing values
        defaults - the Properties that contains all values
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading or writing the file fails for some reason

      • copyMissing

        public static void copyMissing(java.io.File file,
                               java.util.Properties defaults,
                               java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Copies key-value-pairs found in the given Properties but not in the given File into it. The file is not created by this method but is expected to exist and contain a structure readable as Properties.

        Instead of using the sytem's default encoding, this method will use given one to write the file. A comment about the encoding is added to the file if changes need to be saved.

        Parameters:
        file - the file that potentially has missing values
        defaults - the Properties that contains all values
        charset - the charset that should be used to read and write the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading or writing the file fails for some reason
